overview:
James Wong is a seasoned entrepreneur and founder of three successful companies. He is currently the co-founder and CEO of Avidian Technologies, the world leader in Outlook-based CRM software. Under his leadership, Avidian has won the Seattle Mayorâ€™s Small Business Award; was honored in 2005, 2006 and 2007 by Washington CEO magazine as one of the â€œBest Companies to Work Forâ€ in Washington state; was named by the Puget Sound Business Journal in 2006 and 2007 as one of Washingtonâ€™s 100 Fastest Growing companies; was named one of Red Herringâ€™s 2009 North America 100; and has been named to the Inc. 5000 list two years running.

Personally, James has been honored by being included on the Puget Sound Business Journalâ€™s â€œ40 Under 40â€ list and by being awarded the NW Asian Weeklyâ€™s Entrepreneur of the Year award.

Prior to Avidian, James was the co-founder and president of Foci Technologies, which was acquired by Meritage Technologies in 2001. Prior to Foci, James held various positions with Arthur Andersen in New York and the Chevron Corporation in San Francisco.

James is a sought after speaker, writer and leading expert on CRM, SFA, contact management and groupware applications. He has been featured in PC World, PC Magazine, Entrepreneur, CRM Magazine and dozens of other publications. He was also one of the early certified Microsoft Exchange engineers and has been building business solutions on Outlook and Exchange ever since the products were introduced in 1996.

James is the President Elect of the Seattle Chapter of the Entrepreneurâ€™s Organization, the largest entrepreneurial association in the world. He is also an enthusiastic Rotarian and board member of the Rotary Club of Seattle, the worldâ€™s largest and fourth oldest Rotary Club.
